Higher-octane gasoline will not benefit a car that is built to run with a lower octane level, and can cost more than $100 per year.,86 Cost Saving Tip.jpg,1-86 Cost Saving Tip.jpg
It may be tempting to eat
column4: or play loud music while driving. However
column5: these distractions can easily lead to accidents."

cloudText: Check your owner's manual to know your vehicle's weight limit. Exceeding the limit can damage your vehicle and lead to accidents.
If you use a car top carrier, to prevent unstable steering and braking, be sure to pack a stable load with evenly distributed weight.
If carrying things on your car roof (bicycles, cargo carriers, ski racks, etc.), measure the height and watch for clearance height signs.
Never leave your pet unattended inside of your car. Cars can heat up very fast, even with the windows cracked!
